stories.text:
I have a decent job but I aim to get into FAANG or maybe work for a big startup or just ambitious folks. But my ADHD, doesn't allow me to focus on stuff that I don't find fun.

I can work on coding projects in a hyperfocus state for hours if I find it interesting. That is one of my strengths I would say.

Doing Leetcode religiously though, not so much.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to progress in career as a Software Developer with ADHD?
Ukraine’s Draft Dodgers Face Guilt, Shame and Reproach

stories.text:
I recall back when AirBnB was growing (circa 2013-2015 in my mind) the appeal was primarily price. Yes, there were conveniences around having an individual place, etc, but I recall most AirBnBs being priced well below hotels of roughly equal quality.

When I look now, it is often cheaper to stay in a hotel than an AirBnB of roughly equal quality, sometimes significantly so. This pattern has held in at least 10 major/minor US cities I’ve used over at least the past year.

What economic forces are at work to cause this?
stories.title: Ask HN: What Happened to Airbnb Pricing?
